intro: Pedicularis anas subsp. nepalensis, commonly known as the Nepal lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and northern India. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, characterized by its parasitic or semi-parasitic nature. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in rocky and well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually bright red or orange, with a distinctive spurred shape that attracts pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is a herbaceous perennial that exhibits a unique morphology adapted to its high-altitude environment.
